ChannelObjectLinkingRule.name: ChannelObjectLinkingRule
ChannelObjectLinkingRule.description: Represents a rule for linking a channel interaction with an object (such as Lead or Contact).

ActionForNoRecordFound.description: Action to take when no matching records are found.

ActionForSingleRecordFound.description: Action to take when one matching record is found.

ChannelType.description: The type of channel used for this rule.

Description.description: The description for this linking rule.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

IsLinkedRecordOpenedAsSubTab.description: Indicates whether to open the linked record as a subtab when the link is established.

IsRuleActive.description: Indicates whether the rule is active.

Language.description: The language for this linking rule.

MasterLabel.description: The unique label name for this rule.

ObjectToLink.description: The type of object to link to the channel interaction.

RuleName.description: Name of the rule as it appears in the UI. Maximum length is 80 characters.
